questions.question: What is the main focus of the study conducted by Chen, Wei, Fan, Su, Ai, Qiu, Wu, Yin, Pan, and Su?
questions.answer: The main focus of the study is the visualization of anisotropic and stepwise piezofluorochromism in a metal-organic framework (MOF) single crystal.

questions.question: What unique property is achieved for the first time in MOF single crystals according to the study?
questions.answer: For the first time, unique piezofluorochromic anisotropism is achieved and can be accumulated stepwise and visualized by a metal-organic framework single crystal.

questions.question: How does the study propose to achieve tunable and controllable piezofluorochromism in MOFs?
questions.answer: The study proposes achieving tunable and controllable piezofluorochromism in MOFs by arranging mechano-responsive organic linkers into well-defined coordination frameworks to control the photophysical processes among different components and their stimuli-responsive behavior.

questions.question: What potential applications are envisioned for the piezofluorochromic MOF developed in the study?
questions.answer: Potential applications envisioned for the piezofluorochromic MOF include stimuli-responsive photoluminescence sensing, barcoding, signal switching, harvesting, and magnifying micro-devices.

questions.question: What is the significance of achieving anisotropic and stepwise piezofluorochromism in MOF single crystals?
questions.answer: Achieving anisotropic and stepwise piezofluorochromism in MOF single crystals is significant because it provides a basic model for application in various fields, demonstrating the powerful platform of MOFs in revealing complicated photophysical phenomena and functionalities.

questions.question: True or False: The study by Chen et al. is the first to report piezofluorochromic anisotropism in MOF single crystals.
What strategy is used in the study to install two kinds of chromophores in the MOF's coordination framework?
questions.answer: A one-pot two-step assembly strategy is used to install two kinds of chromophores in predefined positions within the MOF's coordination framework.

questions.question: True or False: The piezofluorochromic MOF developed in the study can only exhibit photoluminescence changes when pressure is applied from any direction.
What is the role of ETTC linkers in the piezofluorochromic behavior of the MOF according to the study?
questions.answer: ETTC linkers undergo configuration deformation when outer mechanical stimuli are exerted from appropriate directions, leading to pressure-dependent color and PL changes due to their aggregation-induced emission character.

questions.question: True or False: The study suggests that the piezofluorochromic MOF can be used for data processing and storage devices.
